content.subtitle: How many processes can listen on same port in localhost? I know the answer from school time, and it is ONE port per application.
content.metaDescription: How many processes can listen on the same port in the localhost? Depends on OS configuration and socket options, you could run multiple apps on the localhost with the same port.

paragraphs.name: 29e2
paragraphs.text: Listen to localhost

paragraphs.name: 7d47
paragraphs.text: Photo by Danielle MacInnes on Unsplash

paragraphs.name: 76d8
paragraphs.text: How many processes can â€˜listen toâ€™ the same port of localhost? I know the answer, and it is ONE port.

paragraphs.name: 0baf
paragraphs.text: TL;DR Depends on OS configuration and socket options, you could run multiple apps on localhost with the same port.

paragraphs.name: 688f
paragraphs.text: Run a server Crystal application to listen to port 3000

paragraphs.name: d3ae
paragraphs.text:
[terminal 1] $ cat <<CODE | crystal eval
require "socket"
s = TCPServer.new("localhost", 3000)
while c = s.accept?
   c << "pong\n"
   c.close()
end
CODE

paragraphs.name: 618c
paragraphs.text: I shrank it into one command, so you can start doing experiments right now (if you have Crystal installed, of course). Feel free to save the code to a file and run it via crystal run .

previewContent2.subtitle: How many processes can listen on same port in localhost? I know the answer from school time, and it is ONE port per application.

paragraphs.name: 7f57
paragraphs.text: How to automate building local virtual machines with Packer

paragraphs.name: 339f
paragraphs.text: We will learn how to create a disk image base on a remote iso disk image. Auto install packages and configure a virtual machine with a small configuration file. Setup another disk image, this time, the source would have a different format.

paragraphs.name: 550c
paragraphs.text: Before we continue, all the sources are available in Github.

paragraphs.name: d0e9
paragraphs.text: There are multiple ways to build a virtual machine for experiments. One of the ways is to use Packer. Packer has a big list of integrations: cloud providers, virtual machines, and containers.

paragraphs.name: 71e7
paragraphs.text: Convert GitHub Issue to Pull request

paragraphs.name: 565e
paragraphs.text: The typical difficulty for most GitHub users is to manage 2 cards per task (an Issue and a connected Pull request). It consumes a lot of time and energy to maintain a project, mainly when you create an Issue before you start coding.

paragraphs.name: ffb5
paragraphs.text: TL;DR: hub pull-request attaches a branch to the existing GitHub issue or creates a new pull request: hub pull-request -i <issue number>

paragraphs.name: c00a
paragraphs.text: The most common steps for new users are:

paragraphs.name: d498
paragraphs.text: Create â€œIssue #1â€;

paragraphs.name: fa84
paragraphs.text: Start work on the problem in a new branch;

paragraphs.name: 218a
paragraphs.text: When I was a student, I used a lot Windows. It was hard times and we had to crack tools like Total Commander or FAR manager or upgrade Diabloâ€™s heroes in saves files. I used editors like: WinHex and UltraEdit .
Today I came to similar problem modify binary file in Linux terminal. I started search with one requirements:
